newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - IBM seen poised for fall.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - IBM seen poised for fall.

text.p: International Business Machines Corp shares are expected to decline at the start of U.S. trade Wednesday after the company's 18 percent gain in fourth quarter income failed to please investors.
The market also fretted over IBM's future margins and revenue growth because of disappointing hardware revenue in the fourth quarter, particularly in mainframes.
IBM shares were unable to trade ahead of the U.S. market open due to a Nasdaq halt, but a trader here said the decline would at least mirror IBM's US$5 per share fall to US$163 on the Zurich bourse.
After Tuesday's market close, IBM announced fourth quarter income of $3.93 per share, $0.05 better than the First Call consensus analyst estimate and a $0.84 increase from one year ago.

But the stock began to weaken in after-hours trade last night as close examination of the results got underway, and was then buffeted this morning with multiple analysts' earnings-estimate cuts and a Salomon Bros downgrade to buy from strong buy.
Elsewhere, Compaq Computer Corp shares added 3/4 to 79 on the appeal of the company's fourth quarter $1.64 per share income, up from last's year's $1.17 per share before an $0.87 per share charge.
The results for Compaq latest period exceeded analysts' expectation of $1.53 per share, as compiled by First Call.
Oak Technology and U.S. Robotics also attracted buyers in pre-open trade, both after reporting quarterly earnings.
Oak rose to 16 from 14-9/16 and U.S. Robotics added one to 74-5/8.
